meanings.definition: Drive or force (someone) to do something
meanings.sent1: The strong wind impels the kite to soar high in the sky.
meanings.sent2: His passion for music impels him to practice the guitar every day.
meanings.sent3: The delicious smell of freshly baked cookies impels me to the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The urgent message on the screen impels everyone to take immediate action.
meanings.sent5: The coach's motivating speech impels the team to give their best performance.

meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to feel a strong need or desire to do something
meanings.sent1: The captivating story impels the reader to turn the pages eagerly.
meanings.sent2: Her inspiring words impel her students to work hard and achieve their goals.
meanings.sent3: The tempting aroma of freshly brewed coffee impels me to start my day.
meanings.sent4: The breathtaking view from the mountaintop impels visitors to take photos.
meanings.sent5: The exciting movie trailer impels viewers to buy tickets for the premiere.
